definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to carry in the bosom or the sleeve/to wrap, to conceal

sentences.english: Spitting in the street is considered to be very bad mannered.
sentences.chinese: 拂逆地吐痰，在街上吐痰是很緊張的壞習氣。

sentences.english: The sink is broken in the one downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 樓下那間的下水管壞了。

sentences.english: Metaphysic is the finding of bad reasons for what we believe on instinct.
sentences.chinese: 形而上學是我們爲相信直覺而找到的壞理由。

sentences.english: The bad police officer in that movie thought he was above the law.
sentences.chinese: 那部電影中的壞警察自認不受法律的約束。

sentences.english: In other words, this is an example of good and bad prejudice, right?
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，這個例子裏有好先見和壞先見，是吧？

sentences.english: They treated their servants well, but expected them always to know their place.
sentences.chinese: 他們對待僕人不壞，但期望他們時時安分守己。

sentences.english: Talk to her more and you will find that she isn't 70 bad 71 you thought she was.
sentences.chinese: 和她談過多次你就會發現她不像你原來認爲的那麼壞。

sentences.english: Cause, shucks, us snakes ain't got it bad.
sentences.chinese: 原因，胡說，我們沒有得到蛇是它壞。

sentences.english: After all, I got a not-bad result.
sentences.chinese: 總之，我有一個不算壞的結果。

sentences.english: I'm sorry to be so short-tempered but I have an awful headache.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉脾氣這麼壞，所有是我頭疼得要命。

sentences.english: Maybe the elevated highway was a bad idea.
sentences.chinese: 可能高架公路是個壞的主意。

sentences.english: How should I tell him the not so grelocated at?
sentences.chinese: 我該如何告訴他這個壞音問？

sentences.english: I've broken my kneels, but not my head.
sentences.chinese: 不過我膝蓋摔壞了，腦袋可沒有壞。
玩偶匣的彈簧昨天壞了。

sentences.english: Clean the bearings, or replace them if worn out.
sentences.chinese: 清理軸承，如果已經用壞，請更換新軸承。

definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
